abilities.description: An uncontrollable, monstrous transformation triggered when the user consumes three Rumble Balls within six hours. The user becomes a massive creature with overwhelming physical strength but loses all consciousness and control, attacking indiscriminately. Described by Dr. Kureha as 'the rampage of the Devil Fruit' that destroys allies, enemies, and the user's own body.
abilities.limitations: Completely uncontrollable - the user has no consciousness or ability to distinguish friend from foe. Places extreme strain on the user's body. Can only be triggered by the dangerous act of consuming three Rumble Balls within six hours, which goes against medical safety protocols.

keyMoments.title: Monster Point Transformation Debut
keyMoments.description: Chopper uses Monster Point for the first time after consuming a third Rumble Ball, transforming into a massive, uncontrollable creature with glowing blue eyes.
keyMoments.significance: The first appearance of the Hito Hito no Mi's most extreme and dangerous transformation, representing the raw, untamed power of Devil Fruits when pushed beyond their normal limits.

weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weakness to seawater and Sea-Prism Stone
Monster Point requires three Rumble Balls within six hours, which causes complete loss of control
Monster Point places extreme physical strain on the user's body
The user cannot distinguish between allies and enemies in Monster Point form

reveals.information: Monster Point - the forbidden transformation that represents 'the rampage of the Devil Fruit' itself, triggered by exceeding the safe limit of Rumble Ball consumption
reveals.context: During the battle with Kumadori in the Tower of Justice, Chopper consumed a third Rumble Ball to gain the power needed to defeat the CP9 agent and help save Robin.

reveals.information: Dr. Kureha's warning about the third Rumble Ball creating a transformation that destroys 'allies, enemies, and also his own body'
reveals.context: Flashback to Chopper's training on Drum Island where Dr. Kureha warned him about the catastrophic consequences of taking three Rumble Balls.

fanTheories: Some fans theorize that Monster Point might be a form of partial or uncontrolled Devil Fruit Awakening
There are theories that post-timeskip, Chopper's controlled Monster Point represents mastery over what was originally an awakened state
Some believe Monster Point shows what happens when a Zoan user loses themselves to their animal instincts completely
